Dec. 19, 2001), 60 pp., doi:10.2139/ssrn.1337761.</p>  <p>&nbsp;</p>  <p>ABSTRACT: The teachings and actions of Jesus Christ (Yeshua Ha&#39;Mashiach) and the apostles recorded in the New Testament are analyzed in regard to their ethical and political philosophy, with analysis of context vis-&agrave;-vis the Old Testament (Tanakh, or Hebrew Bible) being given. From this analysis, it is shown that Jesus is a libertarian anarchist, i.e., a consistent voluntaryist. The implications this has for the world are profound, and the ramifications of Jesus&#39;s anarchism to Christians&#39; attitudes toward government (the state) and its actions are explicated.</p></dc:description><dc:publisher/><dc:date>2001-12-19</dc:date><dc:source>http://zenodo.org/record/15607</dc:source><dc:doi>10.5281/zenodo.15607</dc:doi><dc:identifier>http://zenodo.org/record/15607</dc:identifier><dc:identifier>oai:zenodo.org:15607</dc:identifier></dc:dc>   </collection>
